name: svelte-shortcodes
description: Embed Svelte components in rich content using shortcodes.
readme: # svelte-shortcodes Embed Svelte components inside rich content from any CMS using shortcodes. A concept we have shamelessly stolen [from WordPress](https://codex.wordpress.org/Shortcode_API). You can also use this module to replace matching html elements with a custom Svelte component of your choice. ## Installation ```sh yarn add --dev svelte-shortcodes # or npm i --save-dev svelte-shortcodes ``` ## Usage The Shortcodes component will replace every occurrence of the component `name` with a Svelte component of your choice. Both WordPress-style shortcodes and the html tag names will be replaced. ``` ``` Checkout the code inside `/dev` for a full example. ## Development There is a dev app available inside the `/dev` folder that can be used for testing and experimenting with the components. To start it simply run: ```sh yarn dev # or npm run dev ``` ## Todo - [ ] Add tests - [ ] Consider separating html tag names from shortcodes - [ ] Find a better way to handle html fallback ([relevant svelte issue](https://github.com/sveltejs/svelte/issues/2324))
